title: How to Make a Fort for a Teddy Bear

steps.headline: Choose a big, clear room or space.
steps.description: You'll need plenty of space to start building.

steps.headline: Gather 1 small blanket, 1 big blanket, 2 big chairs and some pillows.
Put the two chairs, seat facing the walls, and put them a distance apart.
steps.description: Make sure that the space is small enough for the big blanket to go on top.

steps.headline: Cover the floor with the small blanket and put the pillows on top of the blanket.
Cover the top of the fort with the big blanket and duct tape the edges to the chair.
Find four small chairs and a small blanket.
Choose a good sized place to make the fort.
Place the chairs to form a square shape.
steps.description: For example, have two chairs facing the same way, then two more chairs facing the same way.

steps.headline: Put the small blanket on top.
Clear out anything from under your desk.
steps.description: If there are some cords for something or other, turn them off at the power source.

steps.headline: Find two heavy objects (like a heavy book or a bin filled with sport balls) and a blanket or sheet.
On top of your desk, secure a portion of the sheet (or blanket) under one of the heavy objects.
steps.description: Secure another part of the sheet (or blanket) under the other heavy object. The sheets should fall over the front of the desk and create a cubbyhole. Keep the heavy objects slightly away from the edge; you don't want them falling off.

steps.headline: Fill with snugly cushions and warm blankets.
Place your teddy underneath.
steps.description: Presto! Your teddy has a nice little desk fort and you get to hang out in it too.

text: Two Chair Fort Choose a big, clear room or space. You'll need plenty of space to start building. Gather 1 small blanket, 1 big blanket, 2 big chairs and some pillows.  Put the two chairs, seat facing the walls, and put them a distance apart. Make sure that the space is small enough for the big blanket to go on top. Cover the floor with the small blanket and put the pillows on top of the blanket.  Cover the top of the fort with the big blanket and duct tape the edges to the chair. You're done! Four Chair Fort Find four small chairs and a small blanket.  Choose a good sized place to make the fort.  Place the chairs to form a square shape. For example, have two chairs facing the same way, then two more chairs facing the same way. Put the small blanket on top. Put your teddy inside. Desk Fort Clear out anything from under your desk. If there are some cords for something or other, turn them off at the power source. Find two heavy objects (like a heavy book or a bin filled with sport balls) and a blanket or sheet.  On top of your desk, secure a portion of the sheet (or blanket) under one of the heavy objects. Secure another part of the sheet (or blanket) under the other heavy object. The sheets should fall over the front of the desk and create a cubbyhole. Keep the heavy objects slightly away from the edge; you don't want them falling off. Fill with snugly cushions and warm blankets.  Place your teddy underneath. Presto! Your teddy has a nice little desk fort and you get to hang out in it too.
